questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition for the word: Laborious

choices.answer: Requiring little to no effort
High-pitched and piercing
Requiring considerable effort and time
Mellow and good-natured.

questions.question: Which of the following sentences uses "laborious" properly?

choices.answer: Building the windmill was a laborious, tiring process.
The pigs had a laborious laugh after they finished the windmill.
The windmill was laborious and larger than anything they had built before.
The pigs laboriously ate the milk and apples, without sharing.

questions.question: What does Napoleon tell the hens about giving up their eggs?

choices.answer: They should welcome the opportunity to sacrifice and contribute.
They should be happy about contributing to Naopleon's scheme for power.
They are lucky to have been included in the rebellion.
They will be executed if they do not comply.

questions.question: How does the following commandment change: "No animal should kill another animal..."

choices.answer: ...with a gun.
....ever.
...under duress or stress.
...without cause.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition for the word: Shrill

choices.answer: Irresponsible
High-pitched and piercing
Pleasantly smooth or soft
Rough and coarse

questions.question: Which of the following sentences uses "shrill" correctly?

choices.answer: The girl's shrill voice pierced through the noise of the crowd.
The man's shrill movements stood out in the crowd.
The little boy shrilled, throughout his entire presentation.
The shrillness of the sun made the girl sweat.

questions.question: In Chapter 6, how is Snowball used as a scapegoat?

choices.answer: Squealer tells the animals that Snowball is plotting to kill them.
Snowball is blamed for the destruction of the windmill.
Napoleon tells the animals that Snowball is changing the commandments.
Snowball is blamed for the lack of food on the farm.

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition for the word: Capitulated

choices.answer: To behead
Easily offended
To surrender
To capture

questions.question: Which of the following sentences uses "capitulated" correctly?

choices.answer: Snowball had to capitulate to Napoleon and his dogs so he would not die.
The capitulation scared the animals half to death.
Snowball capitulated and fought back against Napoleon and his dogs.
Napoleon's dogs capitulated the animals who did not follow rules.

questions.question: Why did the hens NEED to surrender their eggs?

choices.answer: Boxer threated to stop working if they didn't give up their eggs.
All the animals were starving.
The other animals voted for the hens to sacrifice their eggs.
The hens insisted on contributing.

questions.question: What rumor is revealed about Snowball?

choices.answer: He is hiding on a neighboring farm.
He has decided to come back to the farm.
He is rebuilding the windmill.
He has planned his own rebellion.

questions.question: What do the confessions and executions foreshadow?

choices.answer: Rebellion and uprising against Napoleon
Revenge for Snowball's malicious revenge
Equality for all animal moving forward
Fair and equitable leadership

questions.question: Which of the following could be a theme from Animal Farm?

choices.answer: Corruption
Absolute power corrupts absolutely.
Nothing good will come from staying silent against atrocities.
Leadership

questions.question: At then end of Chapter 8, what is revealed about Squealer

choices.answer: Squealer is actually Snowball in disguise.
Squealer is a traitor and has been giving information to neighbor farms.
Squealer is planning to overthrow Napoleon.
Squealer has been changing the commandments to suit the pigs' needs.
